resources:
Numplex π
/* -------------------- Complex calculator help activity -------------------- */ To enter an impedance, type it as a complex number. If you want to enter only the negative real or imaginary part, you cannot use the "﹣" button. To insert only one negative part use the "+/-" button.
Example: 2+-3+5i -1.0 + 5.0i
By default, this calculator will always try to find a complex number rather than separate numbers. To enter values separately, you can either use parenthesis or type the imaginary part first.
Example: 2+3i﹣4+i ≠ 2+3i﹣(4)+i
To enter the polar form of an impedance type the modulus followed by "∠" and the argument, using degrees or radians.
Example: 10∠90 10i
To calculate series impedance use the operator "+".
Example: 2+3i + 3+5i 5.0 + 8.0i
To calculate parallel impedance use the operator "||".
Example: 3+3i ‖ 6+6i 2.0 + 2.0i
Cap returns the capacitive reactance.
Example: Cap(10μ, 100) -159.1549430918955i
Ind returns the inductive reactance.
Example: Ind(100m, 100) 62.8318530717958i
You can also use metric prefixes, like m (10-3). This calculator allows these prefixes:
● m = 10-3
● μ = 10-6
● n = 10-9
● p = 10-12
● k = 103
● M = 106
● G = 109
Example: 10m+2μi 0.01 + 0.000006i
You can see more result formats by touching on the result text.
You can enter an input using scientific notation by typing "E" followed by the exponent.
Example: 10E-2+3E5i 0.1 + 300000.0i
To apply higher precedence use parentheses.
Example: ((300 + Cap(10μ,10)) || 200) + 100 292.813587011702 – 22.8750630037484i
You can also do calculations with complex numbers.
Example: ((3+3i + 2+2i ﹣ 1+1i) × 2) ÷ 2+2i 4.0
/* ---------------------------- Boolean activity ---------------------------- */
Use the symbol " ' " to negate the operator.
Example: A·A'
Use the symbol "·" as the AND operator.
Example: B·B
Use the symbol "+" as the OR operator.
Example: A+1
Use the symbol "⊕" as the XOR operator.
Example: A⊕B
/* ---------------------------- Series activity ----------------------------- */
To enter a number series, type the elements followed by commas.
Example: 1, 3/2, 2, 5/2, 3 The sequence is arithmetic with ratio 0.5.
1 + 0.5·(n - 1)
/* ----------------------------- About activity ----------------------------- */

Complex numbers and impedance calculator. Calculations with vectors, planes, lines and points, such as addition, subtraction, angle and distance. Matrix calculations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, determinant, and inverse. Binary, decimal, octal and hexadecimal converter. Also generates binary complements. Calculates from colors to resistor value and from value to colors. Also supports SMD resistors. Greatest common factor and least common multiple. Group randomizer. Number series calculator and expression finder. Boolean algebra expression simplifying calculator.
Algebra Mathematics Electronics Converters Miscellaneous

Firstly, you can directly enter the desired value into the corresponding field. Alternatively, you can opt to adjust the value by altering the colors of the bands on the resistor. The choice is yours! Please choose the number base for the entry. The remaining fields will automatically convert accordingly. In the case of binary numbers representing integers, you can also check the 1's complement and 2's complement representations. To begin, you will need to press this button to add the necessary elements. Next, you should select the specific elements that you wish to utilize for the calculation. At this point, all that remains is to choose the desired calculation to perform. To begin, you will need to press this button to add the necessary elements. Next, the calculator automatically calculates the GCF and LCM values. Select the randomization feature you want here. To begin, you will need to press this button to add the elements you want to randomize. At this point, all that remains is to choose the desired number of random groups to be generated and press 'Generate' To begin, enter the start of the randomization range. Enter the end of the randomization range. Here you can select the amount of numbers to be generated. If you want to generate numbers without repetition, activate this option. Here you can change the separator text between the numbers.
